chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Julian C. Schlottman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Julian C. Schlottman is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Julian C. Schlottman was found guilty of Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Letter to Dodge Correctional re: Transcript
Letter from Court to Defendant re: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Answer to demand for discovery and inspection

records.addlTxt: Case not called. Dodge Correctional thought case was to be called at 10:30. Court reschedules to April 26, 2022 at 11:30 AM

11:28 AM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Julian C. Schlottman appeared by video, in custody. Court states PD still searching for counsel. Defendant states he would like to take offer - Schiek states there are victim issues. Schiek statement to sentence. Defendant states he is being revoked in his other case. Court will set out. Defendant would like to appear by video from Dodge Correctional Institution at next hearing. Waives right to in person appearance. Schiek will send offer to Defendant. Bond continued. adj. 11:35 PM
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 11:15 am.

Answer to demand for discovery and inspection

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on March 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:35 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Julian C. Schlottman appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Dennis G Brown appeared in court for Julian C. Schlottman. Atty Brown statement defendant wishes to waive hearing.  Court questions defendant -defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Atty Schiek statement - will be filing information consistent with complaint.  Atty Schiek states new Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Atty Brown  willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas.  Bond continued.  adj. 1:35 p.m.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:21 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Julian C. Schlottman appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Dennis G Brown appeared in court for Julian C. Schlottman. In receipt of complaint, waive reading - set for preliminary hearing. Bail continued. adj. 01:24 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:18 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Julian C. Schlottman appeared by video, in custody. Defendant states he is on extended supervision/probation hold. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Defendant states he is not employed and homeless. Schiek statement to bail. Court sets bond. adj. 01:24 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 11, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
